alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 1:34PM EST until December 24 at 6:25AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Mad River At Moretown affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River At Moretown. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the mad river begins to leave its banks. Field flooding occurs between Waitsfield and Moretown, and some local roads will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM EST.
